title: Claypot Rice with Chinese Sausage
summary: The recipe Claypot Rice with Chinese Sausage is ready in approximately 45 minutes and is definitely an awesome gluten free, dairy free, and fodmap friendly option for lovers of Chinese food. For 33 cents per serving, you get a side dish that serves 4. One serving contains 199 calories, 5g of protein, and 1g of fat. This recipe is liked by 1 foodies and cooks. If you have lop cheung sausage, rice, salt, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. With a spoonacular score of 58%, this dish is solid. Similar recipes include Claypot Chicken Rice, Beef Claypot Rice, and Claypot Chicken Rice (Rice Cooker ).
instructions: Procedures                                                                              1                                                                            Cut the sausage on a bias into 1/4 inch sections. Alternatively, dice the sausage if you prefer a finer mixture of rice and pork.                                                                                                                            2                                                                            Over low heat, slowly heat a medium-sized claypot on the stove, taking care to do so gradually to prevent the pot from cracking. Add the sausage and sauté. Stir around occasionally to brown the sausage, gradually rendering the fat. With chopsticks or a slotted spoon, remove the sausage from the pot.                                                                                                                            3                                                                            Add the rice and stir around, toasting the grains slightly. Add the pieces of sausage back to the pot. Add the salt. If desired, add the finely chopped vegetables.                                                                                                                            4                                                                            Bring the water to a gentle simmer. Put on the lid and simmer over low heat, for about forty minutes, until the bottom of the rice develops a slightly charred crust and the rest of the rice has just finished cooking through.

steps.step: Cut the sausage on a bias into 1/4 inch sections. Alternatively, dice the sausage if you prefer a finer mixture of rice and pork.
Over low heat, slowly heat a medium-sized claypot on the stove, taking care to do so gradually to prevent the pot from cracking.
Add the sausage and sauté. Stir around occasionally to brown the sausage, gradually rendering the fat. With chopsticks or a slotted spoon, remove the sausage from the pot.
Add the rice and stir around, toasting the grains slightly.
Add the pieces of sausage back to the pot.
Add the salt. If desired, add the finely chopped vegetables.

Bring the water to a gentle simmer. Put on the lid and simmer over low heat, for about forty minutes, until the bottom of the rice develops a slightly charred crust and the rest of the rice has just finished cooking through.
